Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala scored again as he returned to Stuttgart, where he was born, opening the scoring to finally settle German nerves and put them ahead after 22 minutes.
Manuel Neuer made a spectacular double-save with a dangerous freekick from Hungary's captain Dominik Szoboszlai.
Maximilian Mittelst채dt delivered a cross for Ilkay G체ndogan to finish a clinical team move in the 67th minute.
The German team enjoyed their time in Stuttgart, and may be back soon.
Pre-Game Insights: Ahead of the game, Manuel Neuer described Hungary as 'an uncomfortable team that tries to tackle aggressively.'

Coach Julian Nagelsmann did not bother with the past and kept a cool head, revealing that his team talk at halftime 'was not emotional' and dealt more with the team maintaining their tactical structure.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann praised the atmosphere in Stuttgart, saying 'The atmosphere was amazing today. It gives us a good feeling. The stadium was very loud and full of emotion. I like that and it really helps us a lot.'
Ilkay G체ndogan had nothing but praise towards Musiala at the end of the match, saying 'He is maybe the most important one for us at the moment and at such a young age as well.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The German national team does not have a stadium that can be considered their true home, even when hosting Euro 2024.
The crowd provided a much-needed emotional and psychological boost for the Germany squad as Hungary got closer and closer to equalizing.
The locals stood and clapped as Musiala was taken off the pitch in the 72nd minute, and they also loudly cheered to welcome his replacement, Chris F체hrich.
